I will say that it was somewhat clean, but the couch was filthy with stuff hanging from the bottom. It was not something that you really wanted to sit and relax on. In our room, the iron was broken and i saw a few ants crawling on our bathroom floor. The next moring, I got up early and decided to take a walk up to the rooftop to see the pool. In the pictures that I saw of the pool, the water looked pretty clear. Well, the water was actually very cloudy. It really didn't draw me in. The same could be said for the hottub. There were a few lounge chairs around the pool. I will say that there was a good view but you could not see the ocean directly because of the taller building in front of you. By this time, the family that I went with and myself decided that this place was not the place for us. We were not happy or pleased with the accomadations. This was not was advertised or worth the money that we paid for it. We were very disappointed! I want to add that I realize places are sometimes not as good as advertised, and I could usually deal with it! But this was lower than I could stand. For the first time in my life, we decided to check out of this hotel and find another. We went to the desk and spoke with the girl. I have to say that the people who worked at the hotel were very nice and tried to do what they could do for you. Most of the people were young who were from other countries working in the United States for a few months. As I said, they were very nice and I know that they heard a lot of complaints from other people about the place. Well, we spoke to the manager and explained the situation, told him we wanted to check out. We were booked for three nights, stayed one, and wanted him to refund the other two nights that we were not goint to be there. The manager, who I thought was very unprofessional based on his dress and actions, told us that we could check out but he would not refund the money. So we would loose about 500 dollars. He said because we signed some sort of paper when we checked in, we were responsible for payment. Now, don't you think a good , honorable, professional business would just allow you to check out and do what is best for the customer? When speaking to this guy, we did not raise our voices and spoke rationally to him. Well, we tried to explain that we were not happy with the accomadations and service and want to leave. WE didn't want anything for free, we just did not want to pay for the two nights we wouldn't be there.After again giving us the speech why he couldn't do it, he just walked away from us. By the way, the speech sounded like he has done it several times before. Now at this point we could of really caused a scene, but we didn't because we are not that way, could have left and lost all the money, or stayed and enjoyed what we could. We stayed, but I WILL NEVER GO TO THAT PLACE AGAIN! I would encourage those of you who are thinking of going to this place, keep in mind that you are not going to get what you paid for. If the place charged about $150 less a night, it wouldn't be bad. Don't be fooled by thinking because it is only about six years old, it is in good shape. It is not! It needs to be maintained more. As I was checking out, a guy next to me was complaining about the airconditioning in his room and towels. I had to laugh and was thinking, it is not going to get better! It was like paying $20 for gas and getting $2 worth!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: lighthouse55
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a stay in Ocean City. I have to say it was a very enjoyable experience. Everything from the reservation to the stay was wonderful. I got to meet the young lady who took my reservation. Her name was Staci. She was a very friendly young lady. She made me feel welcome from the minute I walked in the door. The room was very clean. I have to say the rooftop was great. What a terrific view of Ocean City. My children loved the rooftop pool. We got a lot of use of the indoor pool due to the heat last week. I have to say this is one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Don was very courteous when checking us out. If only every hotel could have a staff like this hotel. I would want to travel all the time. I liked that it is close to the boardwalk and beach. I will go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, very deceiving photos”
Reviews.Author: noah123
Reviews.Content: We also were tricked by the beautiful photos & web site. First we had to be moved from our original room because of the pet stench in the carpet. Then our new room was not very clean, the balcony was filthy, the toilet felt like a amusement park ride when you sat on it & the handle was broke so it just ran all the time, after several complaints I gave up. The jacuzzi heater was broke the entire time, the rooftop pool was shut done for 2 days & the indoor pool (if that's what you can call it) can not handle more than 4 people & it is full. The staff, except for one very nice girl, are useless and really could care less about you. The simplest hotel task of requesting a extra coffee seem to be a bother for them. All the guest we spoke to in our week there were very dissatisfied with this hotel and staff. DON'T be fooled by the pics & web site for this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews on Here Cannot be from Actual Travellers”
Reviews.Author: traveling81
Reviews.Content: We considered staying here since it was in the top 10 hotels in OC according to Trip Advisor, and is advertised as being pretty new. We decided however to wait until we got out to OC to pick where to stay just to be safe. All I can say is, see it in person and you will just keep driving. Compared to all the big, nice brand name hotels in OC, this looks like a run down old condo building in the Harrison Hall class. The prices are pretty high for this class of hotel also. Me and my wife just saw the hotel, laughed, and decided to go to Park Place instead since they had open rooms. The Monte Carlo is between another building, and the street...so the location is okay, but parking seems very tight. Also during our stay at Park Place there were two ladys standing outside late (like 2am) complaining because there was no one at the front desk to let them in. I really think that the managment of this hotel is loading TripAdvisor with fake positive reviews to lure unsuspecting travellers in (notice how they respond to anything negative blaming the customer)? I hope that anyone who reads this takes the other reviews with a grain of salt.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: labatten
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Hotel Monte Carlo. I liked the location because it is so close to the boardwalk and the amusement parks. The rooftop pool, although nothing spectacular, was a hit with the kids. When I made reservations, I specifically noted that I needed 2 adjoining rooms or rooms next door to each other because I was traveling with children. When the hotel called me on the phone to confirm, the young man told me that this would be "no problem". When I get to the hotel to check in, I am told that not only do they not have adjoining rooms, but they can't even give me side by side rooms. Well, what could I do? The young man at the desk could have cared less. The rooms are sufficient, but definitely not the cleanest and the motel is very noisy at night. I know that I will be back to Ocean City, but not to the Hotel Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are decieving!”
Reviews.Author: cindyrhall
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based upon the information and photos provided on its website. Our stay was for only 4 nights and the only positive attributes about this hotel was the location which is a half a block off the boardwalk and beach the the young staff at the registration desk. Other than that our experience was extremely disappointing. The building's facilities which is only 6 years old is run down and in need of cleaning and repair. A number of the pool lounge chairs were broken and they we not even enough chairs for the registered guests. The website portrays much atmosphere but there was absolutely none including around the pool and the hottub. The hottub water was dirty and green in color and full of sand. At check-in we noticed our room's coffee pot was dirty and full of mold and mildew. The replacement was only rinsed out and still dripping wet. The third replacement was out of the box. Our shower head was broke and not usable for showers and it took two day of complaining before we were moved to another room but only after demanding it. No effort was made by the Manager to repiar in a timely manner. The young folks at the front desk were very polite and helpful but did not have the authority to do much without the Manager's approval which made it very difficult to resolve any issue. When we given a new room the air conditioner was in need of repair but since we were only there for 2 more nights we managed. This hotel has plenty of potential but is managed poorly and has absolutely none of the atmophere as portrayed on the website. I would not go back nor would I recommend it to a friend or acquantance.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Jazkat74
Reviews.Content: I paid a lot of money for a romantic room with a jacuzzi. Yes, I got the jacuzzi but if you can envision a plain room, with dingy carpets, and a nice window view of a brick wall, then you can understand why this was not quite the room I expected. Also, the pictures on the website are somewhat misleading. The photograph of the pool on the roof makes it look wonderful. But in reality, its on a big cement slab (the roof) next to a little hot tub that can hold maybe three people comfortably. Parking is also extremely inadequate. They have three small lots. If you're lucky, you can get a spot in the parking lot thats more than two blocks away. And don't dare bring a second vehicle. They will tell you to park it in public parking. To the hotel's credit, all the necessary amenities were in my room: microwave, tv, refrigerator (not a very cold one), etc. If you want a romantic room with a nice jacuzzi that's in Ocean City, go to Comfort Suites located in the Ocean Gateway. I will not be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the absolute worst place I have ever stayed in my life. The rooms were small and dirty. There was noise in the halls all night, which the management staff did not have any control over. People were pounding on our door at 2:30 in the morning then again at 4:30 each time trying to get into our room. Customer service, these people do not know the meaning of customer service, when we asked for the name of the Owner, the manager just told us to get out and never come back, we never used profanity, and might I add, we are all women in our late 40's. The manager told us that he opens all the mail and throws away the complaints, when asked if he opens up mail that is not addressed to him, but the owner, he said yes. We ended up going to the Holiday Inn on 67th the next morning. The same price and much nicer atmosphere, we also had an oceanfront room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a few night stay over easter break at the hotel monte carlo. This was our first stay and we were extremely happy. The room had all the ammenities perfect for our family of 4, which included a microwave, refrig., coffee maker, toaster, iron and ironing board, cable t.v. with disney and hbo. Inside the hotel there was also a subway which was perfect for lunch and they also served breakfast sandwiches. The indoor heated pool was definitely the kids favorite. The location being right off the boardwalk was probuly mine. Just a hop skip and a jump away from the amusements and games. It was actually quite busy during this week up to easter, but the hotel was always very clean. The staff quite friendly and engaged in conversation with us several times throughout our stay. We may not be back to Ocean City this year, however next year the family and I will return to the Hotel Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Hotel Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: OCB'Walk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monte Carlo - A pleasant stay at OC, MD We stayed June of 2005 and overall it was a nice place to stay. Our room was clean, with a partial ocean view. We talked with the assistant manager several times during our stay and was pleased with the courtesy of all the staff we come in contact with. The only negatives were the small lobby and elevator and the smallish parking lots. Probably rate the hotel alittle better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Stay every year!”
Reviews.Author: Savanah
Reviews.Content: I have just started using trip advisor recently and was so surprised to see a bad review about the monte carlo. My family and I have stayed at the Monte Carlo every year since it opened and we love it. I have a 5 year old and an 8 year old and I cannot imaging where else I would stay to be so close to EVERYTHING! The hotel is safe, clean and convenient. I highly recommend going to the hotel yourselves and seeing what it has to offer. Even if you have already booked somewhere else swing by there during your vacation and check it out. Maybe I am parcial to the monte carlo because I stay there every year now but I wouldn't keep staying there if it wasn't the best location for my family. Make sure you see the rooftop pool deck, that's where we watch the fireworks for the forth of July every year. Good luck with your vacation planning.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw all these 5 star marks and thought to myself are they talking about the same hotel that I stayed in? When I checked trip advisor couple of months ago they had all these bad reviews and all of a sudden they have all these 5 star reviews sounds fishy. Well let me start with the pool. Indoor pool is a joke, it is very small. Hotel rooms have no ocean view what so ever since there are 2 hotels in front of the hotel. I do agree it is located at a convenient place and really close to the beach and all other cool stuff but the hotel itself is horrible. Awful customer service. Tried to talk to the manager about our problem (housekeeping didn't clean the room as they were suppose to, bed sheet was filthy so was the bathroom), but couldn't get hold of him. It is so not worth the high price they charge. So my family and I have decided no matter what we are not going back to this place. For the readers, don't believe everything you read in the other reviews, ask real people who have stayed there. If you really don't believe me go there and check for yourself but please do write a review after you experienced it yourself so that other travelers can know the truth about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would suggest the monte carlo to all who want to have fun in the sun. we all went down from jersey last june. the pool and jacuzzi is where we hung out most of the time. boardwalk and beach were just a couple of feet from the hotel. this hotel is located in the heart of it all. very conveiniant to alot of fun and food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel in August of 2005 and I must say, we definately loved it. We go to Ocean City often for a couple days here and there, but because of how nice our stay was, we have already planned to return for an entire week in August of 2006. The guest service was wonderful (All the way up from the time I reserved my confirmation and made payments over the phone until the time we checked out). The rooms were clean, and the service was very fast. We went out to lunch everyday for an hour and came back to change and in that hour, everything was refilled, beds were made and everything was spotless. The only small minor complaint I have is that the pool was shallow, but it's a very small price to pay for having a pool on a roof with a wonderful view. From the jacuzzi, you could see the ocean, the bay and at night the view of the downtown amusements was gorgeous. It was right around the corner from the boardwalk and beach right in the midst of all the fun! I would definately return again!
